label: Description
value: Brutus stands in profile in the right foreground over the dying Caesar to his left. Caesar shields his head with his tunic and lies before a classical statue representing Imperial Rome. A throng of angry senators are shown, with knives upraised and with fasces in the background. On the upper right, a plinth with S.P.Q.R. (in reverse) appears.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, gray, red, and yellow wash on white laid paper, laid down

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Grafton H. Pyne, New York, NY; 1948: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

Nero Finding the Body of His Mother, Agrippina

label: Description
value: Four Roman men in classical dress stand at the left. The two men in the center wear helmets and soldiers' clothing. The four men gaze upon a dead woman at their right seated in a chair in front of a bed. The man nearest her holds up a dagger and points towards heaven.

A Dominican Female Saint in Ecstasy and Other Studies

label: Description
value: A female Dominican saint kneels, facing half-left, arms extended in attitude of ecstasy. To the right of her figure appear two studies of arms. Above there are two studies of a kneeling man kneeling and touching his brow to the ground.

label: Description
value: The Holy Family is seen at the top of a steep stairway in the background. A shepherd, with sheep, kneels on the right in adoration. A seated angel, left, points towards the scene. A man lies prostrate on the steps in the center foreground, while a dog in front of him climbs the steps. An adoring child and woman stand in the right foreground. The upper corners of the picture are chamfered.

label: Description
value: The view is taken from the Via Sacra, looking towards the Capitoline Hill, with the Arch of Septimius Severus in the right foreground, and behind it, to the left, the columns of the Temple of Saturn. Perspective lines on the left lead towards the Arch.

The drawing is in the shape of a circle, with two triangular-shaped corners protruding from the lower left and lower right.
